configuration.name: widget_08694398080163388
configuration.stem: How might damage to the temporal lobe of the brain affect a person? Which sensory receptor processing would be affected?

feedBack.finalWrongHint: The temporal lobe is involved in hearing and smelling, so damage to this area of the brain might affect the processing of information from mechanical receptors in the ears as well as chemical receptors in the nose.

options.name: mc-opt-item-028151441155932844
options.text: A.	The brain might not be able to interpret messages only from mechanical receptors, so the person might not be able to feel or hear.
options.hint: Look back at the picture to see the functions of the temporal lobe

options.name: mc-opt-item-06761015402153134x1
options.text: B.	The brain might not be able to interpret messages from chemical and mechanical receptors, so the person might not be able to taste, smell or feel pressure on the body.

options.name: _widget_-037945590556734476
options.hint: Look back at the picture to see the functions of the temporal lobe
options.text: C.	The brain might not be able to interpret messages from chemical and electromagnetic receptors, so the person might not be able to smell taste, or see.

options.name: _widget_-020923711743511197
options.hint: Look back at the picture to see the functions of the temporal lobe
options.text: D.	The brain might not be able to interpret messages from input processed by electromagnetic and mechanical receptors, so the person might not be able to see or feel pressure on the skin.
